Summary: Brilliant silver dot, moving east to west, very high in bright sky, no contrail, no sound, no wings, fuselage or empennage. vansihed instantly
divs: Sighting DetailsAt approximately 11:30 am, EST, I was standing in a large grassy area with my grandsons who were flying their kites. My attention was drawn to an extremely brilliant, silvery dot almost directly overhead, moving very slowly east to west. The sky was bright, with a very slight haze of thin cloud. there was no sound, no contrail, no wings, fuselage or empennage. I observed it for approximately six seconds. When I called my wife's attention to it, the object vanished instantly. I am an Air Force veteran with knowledge of aircraft appearance and performance. I was in Military Intelligence with access to mission profiles. I have flown aircraft, including as co-pilot on a chartered passenger plane. In college I majored in Astronomy and Cosmology with a 4.0 average, with extensive knowledge of natural astronomical bodies and events. This object I observed displayed none of the attributes I am familiar with. It was, and is, a UFO.
trends: There have been 3 other sightings in Norton Shores
There were no other sightings in Norton Shores on or around April 5th 2010
